meanings.definition: A medical instrument used to examine the interior of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used the ophthalmoscope to look inside my eye.
meanings.sent2: The ophthalmoscope helped the optometrist see the back of the eye clearly.
meanings.sent3: When the ophthalmoscope peered into my eye, it felt like a tiny flashlight exploring a dark cave.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze was like an ophthalmoscope, penetrating through the layers to see the truth hidden within.
meanings.sent5: The ophthalmoscope revealed the secrets of the eye, like a detective solving a mystery.

meanings.definition: To examine the interior of the eye using an ophthalmoscope.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will ophthalmoscope your eye to check for any issues.
meanings.sent2: I ophthalmoscoped the patient's eye carefully to ensure accurate results.
meanings.sent3: She playfully pretended to ophthalmoscope her friend's eye, causing giggles all around.
meanings.sent4: His intense stare seemed to ophthalmoscope through my soul, leaving me feeling exposed.
meanings.sent5: The researcher ophthalmoscoped the eye of the specimen, revealing fascinating details.
